intro: Grevillea oxyantha subsp. oxyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grevillea, is a shrub native to southwestern Western Australia. It features narrow, linear to lance-shaped leaves that are typically grey-green in color. The plant produces striking red or orange inflorescences composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing drought tolerance. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
